faqs.question: Can foreigners buy property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can purchase property in Spain without restrictions. Non-EU citizens may need to obtain a Spanish tax identification number (NIF) and should consult with a property lawyer regarding specific regulations. PROPERTY Y CONSULTING OFFICE can assist with referrals to English-speaking legal professionals experienced in international property purchases.

faqs.question: What are the costs of buying property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Typical costs include: property transfer tax (6-10% depending on region), legal fees (€800-1,500), property registration (0.1% of purchase price), and notary fees (€600-1,200). Alicante Province transfer tax is typically 6%. Additional ongoing costs include annual property tax (IBI) approximately 0.4-0.6% of cadastral value. Your lawyer can provide a detailed breakdown.
